structural_unit_name.en: Johan Skytte Institute of Political Studies

description.en: The course is divided roughly into two blocks: the first focuses on electoral behavior while the second examines electoral systems. The first half of the course presents the main theoretical approaches to voting behavior, as well as the most important empirical results. It also offers an overview of the major cross-national survey studies in the field. The second half of the course examines the characteristics of electoral systems, their prevalence in the world, ways to measure them, and their effects on party systems.
description.et: Kursus on jagatud kahte suuremasse blokki: valimiskäitumine ja valimissüsteemid. Esimeses blokis tutvustatakse peamisi välimiskäitumist puudutavaid teoreetilisi lähenemisi ning tähtsamaid empiirilisi tulemusi. Teises blokis vaadeldakse erinevate valimissüsteemide tunnuseid ning kasutamist erinevates riikides, mõõtmisviise ning nende mõju parteisüsteemidele.

objectives.en: This course will examine the central institution of representative democracy - elections - including electoral systems, electoral behavior and electoral outcomes.
objectives.et: Kursus vaatleb esindusdemokraatia keskset institutsiooni - valimisi - mitmest eri aspektist (valimissüsteemid, valimiskäitumine, valimiste tulemused).

learning_outcomes.en: Upon successfully passing the course, students will be able to:
1) understand the role of elections in representative democracy,
2) distinguish the impact of different electoral systems on voting and party behavior,
learning_outcomes.et: 2) oskab eristada erinevate valimissüsteemide mõju valimis- ja parteikäitumisele;

learning_outcomes.en: 3) describe, compare, contrast, and critically evaluate the main theories of voting,
learning_outcomes.et: 3) oskab kirjeldada, võrrelda, kriitiliselt hinnata peamisi valimisteooriaid;

learning_outcomes.en: 4) be familiar with the major cross-national databases for survey and electoral data in order to find data for independent research projects
learning_outcomes.et: 4) oskab kasutada peamisi riigiti võrdlevaid küsitlus- ja valimisandmebaase oma uurimisprojekti andmestiku tarbeks;

learning_outcomes.en: 5) design an empirical research project that uses survey and/or electoral data to test theories of political behavior.
learning_outcomes.et: 5) oskab kavandada empiirilise uurimisprojekti, mis kasutab küsitlus- ja/või valimiste andmeid, et testida poliitilise käitumise teooriaid.

independent_work.et:
Reading and discussion tasks. For each session, the participants should prepare and raise issues for discussion on the basis of assigned readings. 

Conceptualisation and operationalisation paper. In the first part of the paper, the participants should choose one concept in political behaviour research and discuss how it can be defined. The aim of the task is to come up with a definition that will also be used in the next assignments in this course. In the second part, they should give a short but concrete overview of how to empirically measure and study the previously defined concept.

Research paper. The paper (no more than 5000 words, all included) is an empirical study of a problem in electoral research. This means that you have to propose and justify one theoretically interesting and relevant question and answer that question on the basis of empirical data. The paper needs to outline the aim of the planned study, theoretical underpinnings, hypotheses as well as what kind of data and indicators would be used to answer the research question. The analysis part will have to give an overview of what you do with the data in order to answer the question and the final section about the results should elaborate and justify what you can conclude about your analysis.

Detailed instructions for all tasks will be provided through Moodle.
